etymologies: late Middle English (originally referring to the Milky Way): via Old French from medieval Latin galaxia, from Greek galaxias (kuklos) ‘milky (vault)’, from gala, galakt- ‘milk’

definitions: a system of millions or billions of stars, together with gas and dust, held together by gravitational attraction.

notes.text: The Galaxy in which the earth is located is a disk-shaped spiral galaxy with approximately 100,000 million stars. The sun is located about two thirds of the way out from the center

shortDefinitions: system of millions or billions of stars

definitions: the galaxy of which the solar system is a part; the Milky Way.
shortDefinitions: galaxy of which solar system is part

definitions: a large group of impressive people or things

examples.text: the four musicians have played with a galaxy of stars

shortDefinitions: large group of impressive people or things
